intro.description:
*Brr Brr Brr Brr*
Your alarm blares. Read on the clock: 7:30 AM. You have no reason to wake up until a paper slides through your apartment's mail slot. It's a letter from the Bureau. The letter reads: "You must report to the Bureau. Your interview is today."
1 month ago, you left your office job because you felt as if it had no meaning. However, finding a meaningful job is difficult, so in a last-ditch attempt, you apply for a job at the Bureau in search of one.

stay_home.description:
Nothing changes. The note is still on the table and you head back to bed.
After a while, you wake up again, and you....

choices.text: Go to the Bureau after all

world_moves.description: The world moves without you. You disappear.

bureau_arrive.description:
You head out onto the gray streets. The Bureau stands 200 stories tall with a fenced-off perimeter with a guard for every citizen. You hand your letter to a guard, enter the building, and head up the elevator. You exit the elevator and are greeted by a large front desk.
The clerk asks you: "Welcome. Please take a seat and wait for your number to be called."
You are handed a number. It says #707.
You look over at a display, which shows Currently Serving: #101
Others sit in the chair staring ahead, sitting quietly.

choices.text: Wait a while, but then leave

interview_wait.description:
After a while, he is called into the interview room.
Your evaluation begins.
The interviewer asks: "Why do you want to work at the Bureau"

interview_lose_interest.description:
You say: "I don't see why it matters."
The interviewer stares at you for a moment, then looks down at their clipboard.
"That is not a correct answer. You will not qualify for a job here."
You nod once. No argument. No regret.
You leave the room. The hallway outside is silent. No one notices you. The world continuesâ€”unchanged, unbothered. Nothing comes next. And somehow, that is enough.

leave_early.description:
You wait for about an hour, but start to feel as if this will not change anything. There is no point in trying to find a meaning to feel fulfilled.
You stand up and start to leave the room. Behind you, a voice yells:
"You can't leave! You have to finish your application to stay here!"
You leave anyway.

interview_ask_accomplishments.description:
Interviewer: "You are very accomplished. You will fit right in. But one last thing: This job requires you to be always truthful."
You are handed a big packet with all the conditions for this job.

agree_job.description: You agree and you feel content as you feel like you are one step closer to finding meaning for yourself.

disagree_comply_job.description: The condition feels hollow, perhaps even a tool of control. You disagree with its spirit, yet you need this. With a sigh that acknowledges the inherent absurdity, you comply to get the job.
